medical_history.chief_complaint: Abdominal pain migrating from periumbilicus to RLQ and nausea
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient reported abdominal pain that started diffusely above her belly button during breakfast and migrated to the lower right abdomen. The pain has increased in intensity and is currently crampy and constant. Symptoms began at an unspecified time in the morning. The patient has vomited four times since the morning, with the vomit being slightly yellow and not bloody, and has experienced anorexia, remaining NPO since the morning.
